data.text:
The Position

For our Drug Product Development Strategies & External Projects team within the department Pharmaceutical Development we are looking for a Post Doc for development of paediatric dosage forms from January 2025 onwards (Biberach, Germany).

In this role, you will play a key role in formulation and process development for paediatric dosage forms of New Chemical Entities (NCEs), working closely with various internal and external development functions. Your work will be instrumental in taking innovative, patient-centred products from early clinical development to international regulatory approval. If you have a passion for challenges and want to work in a dynamic, international environment, an enriching career with diverse development opportunities awaits you.

This Position is limited for 2 years.

Note: To make it easier to find our job advertisements, we use the usual designation "Post Doc". Of course, this advertisement is not only addressed to applicants directly after completing their doctorate, but to all qualified candidates.

Tasks & responsibilities

In your new role, you will work on state-of-the-art pharmaceutical technologies for paediatric formulations (solid oral dosage forms and liquid formulations) and gain broad insights into the pharmaceutical and analytical aspects of dug product development.

Furthermore, you will independently plan, execute, and evaluate experiments.

Additionally, you will perform literature research on emerging formulation concepts, familiarize yourself with the regulatory framework for their development and registration.

Moreover, you will develop a path forward for their implementation.

You will work in multidisciplinary teams of scientific specialists from various fields and present your result both internally and externally and will expand your network to include University and other Industry Partners.

Requirements

Completed master's degree/diploma with doctorate in pharmacy, pharmaceutical technology or related discipline, ideally with a focus on patient-centric dosage form development

Profound theoretical and practical knowledge on solid and liquid oral dosage forms and on development and/or manufacturing processes in commercial production environment.

High problem-solving competence for technical, organizational and strategic challenges, and a scientific mindset

Excellent organizational and communication skills to interact with a variety of interfaces

Fluency in written and spoken English and German

Ready to contact us?

If you have any questions about the job posting or process - please contact our HR Direct Team, Tel: +49 (0) 6132 77-3330 or via mail: hr.de@boehringer-ingelheim.com

Recruitment process:

Step 1: Online application - application deadline is September 3, 2024.

Step 2: Virtual meeting mid of September 2024

Step 3: On-site interviews end of September till beginning of October 2024

Please include the following documents when applying for this position: Cover letter
